metadata.title: CVE-2022-3775 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When rendering certain unicode sequences, grub2's font code doesn't propervalidate if the informed glyph's width and height is constrained withinbitmap size. As consequence an attacker can craft an input which will leadto a out-of-bounds write into grub2's heap, leading to memory corruptionand availability issues. Although complex, arbitrary code execution couldnot be discarded.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.06-2ubuntu14
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu14
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.06-2ubuntu14
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu14
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.187.3~20.04.1+2.06-2ubuntu14.1
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.187.3~20.04.1+2.06-2ubuntu14.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'does not impact secure boot').
grub2-unsigned package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.06-2ubuntu14').
grub2-signed package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.187.3~20.04.1').
